javadoc:
Defines methods for accessing a workspace; a workspace is
 simply a group of running tools and their templates.

methods.javadoc:
Get the running tools in the workspace.
@return list of running tools or zero-length array if there are no tools in the workspace
methods.name: getTools
methods.comment: Get the running tools in the workspace.

return.comment: list of running tools or zero-length array if there are no tools in the workspace

methods.javadoc:
Launch an empty tool.
@return name of empty tool that is launched.
methods.name: createTool

return.comment: name of empty tool that is launched.

methods.javadoc:
Run the tool specified by the tool template object.
@return launched tool that is now running.
methods.name: runTool
methods.comment: Run the tool specified by the tool template object.

return.comment: launched tool that is now running.

methods.name: setName

throws.comment:
if newName is already the
 name of a workspace.

methods.javadoc:
Set this workspace to be the active workspace, i.e.,
 all tools become visible.
 The currently active workspace becomes inactive, and
 this workspace becomes active.
methods.name: setActive
methods.comment:
Set this workspace to be the active workspace, i.e.,
 all tools become visible.
 The currently active workspace becomes inactive, and
 this workspace becomes active.

name: Workspace
comment:
Defines methods for accessing a workspace; a workspace is
 simply a group of running tools and their templates.
